title: The Seminar
description: Andy tries to host a small business seminar at the office. Michael agrees to help by posing as a Greek entrepreneur, and tries to get Holly to play along.

quotes.speaker: David Brent
quotes.text: Oh, sorry, mate.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [English accent] Oh, sorry, mate. Excuse me. Mate.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: [laughing] What you doing?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: English?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You picked on the wrong person, I can tell you that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Oh no no, I'm not picking on you at all. You're English, correct?

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Yeah big time, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I'm working on an English character. Would you mind gi...  It's called Reginald Pooftah.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Ooh! David Brent, my liege. How are you?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Michael Scott.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Oh, there you go. I do characters as well. I got a Chinese fella. He's called Ho Li [bleep].  That's what it sounds like.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughing]

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Herrow! Herrow!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I do Ping. Herrow. I Ping!

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: You can't do that these days. You can't.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, no, no. And people don't understand that is has nothing to do with making fun of a different nationality.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: No, no. No, comedy is a place where the mind goes to tickle itself. That's what she said. [laughs]. [hugs Michaels] Ohh.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That's good. Pleasure to meet you.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Where are you working?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Any jobs now?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, not right now.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: Just let me know.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: All right. See you around.

quotes.speaker: David Wallace
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Bye-bye. What a nice guy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Your first student is here, Mister Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's actually "Master of Ceremonies" Bernard.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Last year, I went to a seminar called "The Ten Secrets of Real Estate". Turns out it was just a ploy to sell me time-shares in Idaho. Cut to, you know, spending a weekend in Boise, terrible time, super lonely. But I get to thinking maybe I should put on my own seminar to lure clients.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh it's... [points to conference room]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [enters] [in a gruff voice] Hello, I am here for the small business seminar.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Nein! I'm greek! My name is Mikanos.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ooh. Wait, Michael?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I am the plant. Every great seminar has one. My job is to make the speaker look good, and I do this through the techniques of leading questions and laughing at all jokes. And the character "Mikanos", is just a little added flava. "Mikanos" is loosely based on another character I do, "Spiros", who is more about the ladies.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you so much Tuna Turner. You are simply the best.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Listen, this isn't a favor, all right?  This is a good idea. We all win.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Go higher. I get super flexible when I'm nervous.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Wow. [sees guy at Erin's desk] Stop, stop, stop, stop, stop, stop. Hey, Andy, I'm really, really sorry to do this to you, but I have a meeting today that I totally forgot, so I can't be apart of this seminar.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. What? You can't do that. You are a critical part of this seminar. You're the charming warm-up guy,

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: If the seminar was a meal, you'd be the amuse-bouche. You like, signal the flavors of the whole night.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm really sorry. I can't do it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: You can't. You can't.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can't have this go badly. I'm a terrible salesman, and I haven't been making very many sales lately, or ever. This is my only idea on how to turn things around. If it goes badly, I might lose my job, which would suck because this is the only job I've ever been good at.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Will you let me know when this whole seminar thing's over?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: What's going on? Do you know that guy?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I just have a meeting, uh, outside the office.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [to Erin] How are the marks?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are some of your small business ideas?

quotes.speaker: Older guy
quotes.text: I was thinking we could buy up of abandoned mine shafts.

quotes.speaker: {Phyllis}, {Stanley}, {Dwight}
quotes.text: Oooh!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: That's great. There's a big, big future in that.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: A lot of mines in Scranton.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Um, what about you?

quotes.speaker: Younger Guy
quotes.text: Uh, credit cards.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Younger Guy
quotes.text: My company would act as an intermedium, for like, point two cents off every transaction.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Wow!

quotes.speaker: Younger Guy
quotes.text: Something with cell phones. It's like, every time you make a phone call I'd make point two cents. Or anything like any on-line shopping I would get point two cents.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Right. Okay? Great.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Great.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You promised us whales. These are worms.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They're not worms, Dwight, okay? They're just people with tiny businesses. They're baby whales which is even cuter.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: I'm out.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Stanley, you're suppose to close.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: I'm out too.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What? I already lost Jim. Salesmen are suppose to help each other out. We're suppose to be a team.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: We're no more a team than the people staying in the same hotel are a team.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You know what might be kind of fun?  I was thinking , you know Andy is having a seminar today? What if we went in as a greek couple? Mikanos and...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Oh, I don't know, Michael. I'm not feeling up to that.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Holly broke up with A.J last week, which is the greatest thing that has ever happened... to me. To Holly, it's been the worst week of her life, and I know for a fact that there was a week for her in high school when she got mono and her first period ever. Too much information? That's what I thought. But, you know what? Here I am using it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Mikanos] If-a you change-a you mind, why don't you talk to Mikanos?

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Is Mikanos greek? He sounds Italian.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ugh. You're the fifth person to tell me that today.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Maybe Mikanos ran away to join the Italian circus.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Okay, yeah, like a character history. Good. Tom Hanks does that.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [muttering] Down... there. [to Pam] Is "jlp" a word?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: "Jelp?" J-e-l-p?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, j-l-p. Like, "I jlp... I jlp you!"

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think that's a word.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm playing Scrabble with Gabe, and I've never won a game.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: The winner gets to pick the movie we watch. I have won no games. So far I've seen "The Shining", "Rosemary's Baby", "The Ring". Not really my thing. Although, I... I do like the early parts of the movies where they have a perfect family and everything.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You want some help?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: K-a. "Ka"? What does "ka" mean?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: It means you're playing someone who's going to destroy you. Why did you play "moo"?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Because I'm playing to win. I'm playing "moo", I'm playing "milk". Whatever it takes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Okay, but look, you could have hit "mood". Would have played a...

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Uh...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: A triple word.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Like the cow mood yesterday. God.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Or moon.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: The cow jumped over the moon.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: She's stuck on that one thing.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, it doesn't have to just be cow stuff, right?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Kevin, Jim dropped out of my seminar, and I'm just... I was wondering if you could replace him as my charming warm up guy.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Andy, I'm no Jim. The only way that I'm Jim is in the movie version when Jim sees what his future would be like if he never met Pam.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, that's crazy talk. I think you're great.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Then I won't let you down.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Cake.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: In you go.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hi, Ryan, you went to business school, right?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yup.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I need somebody to talk to this seminar about business.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Can you do it?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Okay. I don't... I don't like committing to things just like that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So no?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: No, I don't like committing to not doing things, either. That's just as big a commitment.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Oh, baby.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What do I put you down for, bro hombre?

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Yes, I'll do it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, than you so much. It's going to be so awesome.

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: And if I flake, I flake.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Kevin, you open it up.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ryan, you come in with your small biz expertise, right? And then Creed:

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Welcome everybody. Awesome to see you guys. My name is Andy Bernard but you can call me The Nard Dog.

quotes.speaker: Older Woman
quotes.text: Hi Nard Dog. I'm Lu Peachem.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Let's get things started, shall we? You guys ready to hear from the Dunder Mifflin business experts? Good. Well, as you can see on your program... first up is a speech called, "Don't Just Dream it, do it." Yes! Please give a big hand to Mr. Kevin Malone. [plays Ozzy Osboure's Crazy Train]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [running laps around the conference room] Yes!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: There are some people who have charm and some people who don't. Guess which type I am. Charm type.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [out of breath] Dream... big. Right? So what I want you to do is dream the biggest that you c... an. [coughing] And then double it! [coughing].

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Are you okay?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No. Yes!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Here...

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No. I'm fine. Okay, from here now. The first lesson that I'm gonna teach you, right, is about finding success. And the key to finding success is to picture a winner. [coughing] [vomiting]. Okay, so then, what are you picturing right now, right this second? 'Cause the universe is yours, people. Get out of the way! [runs out of room]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm really excited to introduce you guys to Ryan Howard. He has achieved a great deal in the last...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: But perhaps no achievement is greater than his on-again, off-again girlfriend.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What are you...

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Who am I? I'm Kelly Kapoor, the business bitch.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: It is important to brand yourself, so I have a couple of things in works. "The Business Bitch", "The Diet Bitch", "The Shopping Bitch", "The Etiquette Bitch."

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: I could sit here, and I could tell you the ten secrets of business, and you would have a great time, and you would learn a lot. But who better to tell you than the Yale University adjunct professor in management, Professor Scott Powell, who I have on my Blackberry. It's ringing.

quotes.speaker: Professor Powell
quotes.text: Hey, Kelly Kapoor. What a delicious surprise.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Profess Powell, you are on speakerphone.

quotes.speaker: Professor Powell
quotes.text: Uh, why?

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Do you think you could tell us the ten secrets of business?

quotes.speaker: Professor Powell
quotes.text: Um, there aren't really ten secrets.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Come on Scott, please? It's me.

quotes.speaker: Professor Powell
quotes.text: Um, all right. Well, um, I guess know your market would be key. Practice fiscal discipline.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Mm-hmm.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That brilliant little bitch.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: A little treat for our old friend Gabe. Put that "q" right there.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wait. Why?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Put the "q" there, sweetie.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think there's better...

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Put the "q" there! [phone rings] Sorry I yelled.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You could have just told us what you were thinking.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: There's no theater in that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: There's no yelling in that, either.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Well...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: What do you do in your free time?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Mikanos] Practice Olympics.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Mmm. Do you like movies?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Mikanos] I like the musical "Grease", or as we call it, "home".

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: We have to try this out on somebody.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Mikanos] Hello.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: Look, you want to order something?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: She will have a greekaccino.

quotes.speaker: Hank
quotes.text: I don't know what that is.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: It...

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [with accent] It's a very strong coffee with milk from a goat.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [laughs] I can't believe-ee. It's a miracle. She can talk!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: No more brain damage.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No more brain damage!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Ahh!

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Ladies and gentlemen, our special guest speaker will provoke you. He will inspire you. He is... Creed Bratton. [applause]

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Two eyes, two ears, a chin, a mouth, ten fingers, two nipples. A butt, two kneecaps, a penis. I have just described to you the Loch Ness Monster. And the reward for its capture? All the riches in Scotland. So I have one question:

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: I picked out our movie. It's called "Suspiria". It pushes all the boundaries. All your preconceived notions about what horror can be come crashing down.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: When I win...

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Ooh.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: We're gonna watch "Wall-e", where all the boundaries of color are pushed.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: It is hard to explain why Erin is doing so well today. The only thing I can think is Erin is living out some "Slumdog Millionaire" scenario, where every word she's playing has a connection to her orphan past. It's possible.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: So what's your crazy business pipe dream?

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: Well, I started my own golf supply company.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [unimpressed] Really?

quotes.speaker: Guy
quotes.text: It's taken off faster than I expected, so I came here to learn about creating manageable growth.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [quietly] Phyllis?

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Hmm?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Some of these people are for real.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, friend. How's it going? Oh, you know what? Let me steep that for you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, you know what? Good news. We're back in. Let's go sell some paper, Buddy. Huh?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Ahem!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Excuse me.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I got it. I got it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [turning towards Darryl] Hey, do you need a lozenge?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [whispering] They're a bunch of jackals.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: They left you in the lurch, and if they want to jump in, it means you're almost there. You did this. Bring it home.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to Dwight, Stanley, and Phyllis]:

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hi. Hope you enjoyed your lunch. Welcome back. [to Michael and Holly] Ooh. Well, hello. Welcome to the seminar. Hey, man. What's goin' on?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [whispering] You're gonna blow it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Maybe. Only maybe.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: We got it! Wow! We got it!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oscar, wait. I think the victory would be more meaningful if Erin puts the last word in herself.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes, Pam. Yes, most definitely. Yes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [pulls phone back] Ah. No! [laughing] [hands phone back]. Although I must say, I will have "apoplexy" if you lose. Do you understand? "Apoplexy" is what I will have.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Apoplexy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Got it. [plays word] Oh, Oscar. Oscar?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I played "ape."

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [on phone] I just want to make a point to that last caller. I disagree. I don't think it is the running game at all. I think we do have to make a few moves in this off-season.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wow! What a day, right? Guess you guys are probably ready to go. And you got my business card, so...

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Mikanos] Dah, dah, dah, dah, dah. You know, I like you. I'm going to give you my secret gyro recipe. Come out here since it's a secret, and I'll tell you. [exits conference room] [normal voice] All, you have to close right now.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, I mean, I'm getting to it.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, you're not. You're getting past it. You have to close. You can do it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Andy, what's the problem?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: This is hard for me. I'm a nice guy.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: You, Kelly and Creed, Kevin, they believe in you. Don't let them down. Don't let yourself down, Andy. I'm gonna go back in. I'm going to stall them for a little bit. I want you to get your head together, and then come back in. I want you to close. [entering conference room] [as Mikanos] What is taking that guy so long?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Psst. You think this thing's gonna go much longer?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't know. They're still in there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ohh! Good-bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Stop. Out with it.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Here's the story. That guy in there is Jim's childhood friend, Tom.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Tom Witochkin. One of my best buddies, actually.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And when they were both in the third grade, Jim was placed in the top reading group.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I was blue group, so it was second from the top.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And Tom...

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Was in the green group.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And Jim's mom suggested that Jim spend time hanging with the kids in his reading group, because she though that would be a good influence.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: And that's what I told him.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Right. But how'd you say it?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: "My mom thinks you're too dumb to hang out with."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Okay, who would like to purchase this small business package from me right now? Yes, we got one. Okay, the snowball is rolling. Who else? You can put it off for a couple of days, but I guarantee you, eventually you're gonna realize you need this. So the only thing that's gonna be different is you'll be a couple of days behind where you would be if you bought this from me right now. So who's gonna buy one right now?

quotes.speaker: Older Woman
quotes.text: I'll take one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yes! Awesome! All right, anyone else? [younger guy raises hand] Sold! Anybody else? [older guy raises hand] Yes! All right!

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Yeah bitch.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Good choice. The rest of you are dead to me. You made the stupidest decision of your life.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [quietly] No, no, no.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: But it was a pleasure meeting you, and you've got my information, so feel free to call anytime.

quotes.speaker: Kelly
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Hey, you think it's cool if I grab a soda?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, woah. [deeper voice] Yep, absolutely, go ahead.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: How's it goin'?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Pretty good.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: It's been a while.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It has been, yeah.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: So you work here, huh?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Sales.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Must be a front for some kind of famous laboratory. [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs]

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: 'Cause you're so smart.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, man. You remember that, huh?

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Oh, barely. I'm so dumb, you know, stuff goes in, stuff goes out. Not like you probably remember every paper sale you ever made. Paper salesman genius.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: All right, good catch-up.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: See ya.

quotes.speaker: Tom
quotes.text: Where's your jetpack, Zuckerberg?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Andy. I didn't think you had it in ya.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well, I guess when you looked in me, you forgot about my balls. They're on the outside. Don't how you missed 'em.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: [with accent] Wonderful seminar!

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [as Mikanos] Almost as good as the first day when we first met. You are the love of my life. Come to me, Necropolis. Put your lips on my lips. Come on.

quotes.speaker: Holly
quotes.text: Michael, I should get back to work.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What? Come on. It's time for grapes. [regular voice] Real fun day.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: So, I won.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I know. You get to pick.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Well, that's actually what I came to talk to you about. I know how much you want to watch "Wall-e".

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yes?

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: So I got us a compromise. This movie's called "Hardware". It tells the story of a killer combat robot, just like Wall-e, that the government invented to destroy humans. It's some of what you like and some of what I like, and... married...

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Hey, I heard you talking about movies before, and, anyway, I just watched this over the weekend. I thought you'd really like it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: There's a "Shrek" two?!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh, yeah. See you tomorrow.

quotes.speaker: Gabe
quotes.text: Nice guy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Ohh. [laughs]
